intro: Sulcorebutia vasqueziana var. losenickyana, commonly known as the Losenicky's Pincushion Cactus, is a compact, spineless cactus native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It features a short, cylindrical stem covered in dense, white to pale green areoles, which bear clusters of pale yellow to white flowers. The plant is adapted to extreme drought conditions, storing water in its fleshy stem and having a shallow root system. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and is prized for its ornamental value in rock gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
